João Victor Salvajoli

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/2082716851205027
  • Última atualização do currículo em 08/09/2019

Possui graduação em Medicina pela Faculdade de Medicina de Marilia (1977) e doutorado em Medicina (Radiologia Clínica) pela Universidade Federal de São Paulo (1998). Atualmente é médico responsável pelo serviço de Radioterapia e Radiocirurgia do HCor (Hospital do Coração); foi coordenador do serviço de radioterapia do Instituto de Radiologia do Hospital das Clínicas da FMUSP - InRad e coordenador do serviço de radioterapia do Instituto do Câncer do Estado de São Paulo Octávio Frias de Oliveira. Tem experiência na área de Medicina, com ênfase em Radioterapia, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: radioterapia, braquiterapia, câncer, prostata e tratamento. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Projetos de desenvolvimento
2008 - Atual
Optimization of radiotherapy dose-fractionation in elderly and/or frail patients with glioblastoma multiforme
Descrição: Glioblastoma multiforme is the most frequent malignant brain tumor in adults. Its incidence is in rising, especially in elderly. ln these cases, radiotherapy plays an indispensable role in prolongation of patient's life and palliation of distressing symptoms. However, an optimal radiotherapy treatment (dose-fractionation) of elderly and/or frail patients with glioblastoma multiforme with radiotherapy is unknown. With the objectives of optimizing treatment outcome (palliation), quality of life and the optimized use of radiotherapy in limited resource setting, clinical study/trial is needed to scientifically address these goals. By optimizing radiotherapy and evaluating the optimal fractionation regimenin a resource sparing approach, it is expected that institution will benefit from the rational use of existing equipment and staff levels, decreasing costs, yet providing optimal treatment for elderly and/or frail patients with glioblastoma multiforme. Two dose fractionation regimens wil\ be tested, one using 25 Gy in 5 daily fractions in one week ànd another one using 40 Gy in 15 daily fractions in 3 weeks..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Desenvolvimento.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: João Victor Salvajoli - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): International Atomic Energy Agency - Cooperação.

Marcel Davi Loureiro de Melo. Outras informações relevantes

 
68th BrainLAB Academy Radiotherapy Training taking place April 16-19, 2007. Hereby knowledge in the field of patient treatmentplanning using iPlan RT and BrainSCAN was btaied, as wel as knowledge of the hardware and software for treatment planning of IMRT cases. The Clinical implemetation of the BrainLAB m3 Hig-Resolution Multileaf Collimatr and Exac Trac X-Ray 6D patient positioning software was gained during an on-site vist at the University Hospital Dresden, Germany.
3rd Modular Course on Sterotactic Radiotherapy and Radiosurgery:
- Focusing on skull base indications at the University Hospital Charité Berlin, Germany taking place September 17-18, 2007, Berlin, Germay;
- Focusing on vascular malformations at the University Hospital Charité Berlin, Germany taking place September 18-19, 2007, Berlin, Germany;
 - Module 3 - Stereotactic Bdy Radiotherapy, including oral sessons and discussion rounds focusing on extra-cranial indications such as head & neck, lung and liver tumours as well as prostate cancer at the Universiteit Ziekenhuis Brussel taking place Septemner 20-21, 2007, Brussels, Belgium.
